org.cougaar.planning.ldm.lps
Class ReceiveTaskLP

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.planning.ldm.lps.ReceiveTaskLP
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogicProvider, MessageLogicProvider
public class ReceiveTaskLP
extends java.lang.Object
implements LogicProvider, MessageLogicProvider

Take an incoming Task (excepting Rescind task) and add to the LogPlan w/side-effect of also disseminating to other subscribers. Only adds tasks that haven't been seen before, allowing stability in the face of wire retransmits.

init

public void init()
Specified by:
init in interface LogicProvider

execute

public void execute(Directive dir,
                    java.util.Collection changes)
Adds Task to LogPlan... Side-effect = other subscribers also updated. If the task is already in the logplan, then there is probably a change in task preferences. If there is no change in task preferences, then it might be the case that the sending agent has undergone a restart and is trying to resynchronize its tasks. We need to activate the NotificationLP to send the estimated allocation result for the plan element of the task. We do this by publishing a change of the plan element (if it exists). Also, the received task may have been deleted. If so, complete the deletion process by actually removing the task from the blackboard.

Specified by:
execute in interface MessageLogicProvider
